alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 7:13PM EDT until August 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast Georgia, Bryan, Chatham, Liberty, Long and McIntosh. In southeast South Carolina, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in many areas, with as much as 4 to 5 inches over parts of Liberty County. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond Hill, Tybee Island, Darien, Coffee Bluff, Windsor Forest, Tibet, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Wilmington Island, Hutchinson Island, Fort Pulaski National Monument, Jones, Montgomery, Thunderbolt, Midway, Riceboro, Vernonburg, Halfmoon Landing and Harris Neck.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
